snippet: Investigative reporting and opinion commentary are the two high grounds of Chinese journalism, and the Communist Party has cracked down on both.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Chinese journalist Xiao Shu, former opinion writer at Southern Weekend newspaper, describes his experience with Chinese government's crackdown on news media; contends that public vigilance is essential if progress toward journalistic independence is to occur in China.
lead_paragraph: Investigative reporting and opinion commentary are the two high grounds of Chinese journalism, and the Communist Party has cracked down on both.

headline.seo: Dim Hopes for a Free Press in China
headline.main: Dim Hopes for a Free Press in China
headline.print_headline: Dim Hopes for a Free Press in China
